• has	quick,	difficult	or	
grunting breathing, 
or unusual periods of 
breathing, for example 
breathing with pauses of 
over 20 seconds between 
breaths;
• is very hard to wake, 
unusually drowsy or 
doesn’t seem to know you; 
 
• develops a rash of red 
spots  that do not fade or 
lose colour (blanch) when 
they are pressed (see the 
‘glass test’ on the next 
page). This may be the rash 
of meningococcal disease 
and meningitis, which 
causes infection in the 
blood. There may not be
